name: paper-radio-group
description: `paper-radio-group` allows user to select only one radio button from a set. Checking one radio button that belongs to a radio group unchecks any previously checked radio button within the same group. Use `selected` to get or set the selected radio button. Example: See paper-radio-button for more information about `paper-radio-button`.

noink.name: noink
noink.description: If true, ink ripple effect is disabled.

nobar.name: nobar
nobar.description: If true, the bottom bar to indicate the selected tab will not be shown.

noslide.name: noslide
noslide.description: If true, the slide effect for the bottom bar is disabled.

scrollable.name: scrollable
scrollable.description: If true, tabs are scrollable and the tab width is based on the label width.

disableDrag.name: disableDrag
disableDrag.description: If true, dragging on the tabs to scroll is disabled.

hideScrollButton.name: hideScrollButton
hideScrollButton.description: If true, scroll buttons (left/right arrow) will be hidden for scrollable tabs.

selectedItem.name: selectedItem
selectedItem.description:
Returns the currently selected element. In multi-selection this returns
an array of selected elements.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use
`selected`.

selectedModel.name: selectedModel
selectedModel.description:
In single selection, this returns the model associated with the
selected element.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use 
`selected`.

selectedIndex.name: selectedIndex
selectedIndex.description:
In single selection, this returns the selected index.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use
`selected`.

excludedLocalNames.name: excludedLocalNames
excludedLocalNames.description:
Nodes with local name that are in the list will not be included in the selection items. In the following example, `items` returns four `core-item`'s and doesn't include `h3` and `hr`.

Header

Item1 Item2
Item3 Item4

target.name: target
target.description:
The target element that contains items.  If this is not set 
core-selector is the container.

itemsSelector.name: itemsSelector
itemsSelector.description:
This can be used to query nodes from the target node to be used for selection items. Note this only works if `target` is set and is not `core-selector` itself. Example:



color = {{color}}

activateEvent.name: activateEvent
activateEvent.description:
The event that would be fired from the item element to indicate
it is being selected.

notap.name: notap
notap.description:
Set this to true to disallow changing the selection via the
`activateEvent`.

updateBar.name: updateBar
updateBar.description:
Invoke this to update the size and position of the bottom bar.  Usually
you only need to call this if the `paper-tabs` is initially hidden and
later becomes visible.

params.name: wrapped
params.description: if true and it is already at the first item,

selectNext.name: selectNext
selectNext.description:
Selects the next item.  This should be used in single selection only.

                 wrap to the front

params.name: wrapped
params.description: if true and it is already at the last item,

core-select.name: core-select
core-select.description:
Fired when an item's selection state is changed. This event is fired both
when an item is selected or deselected. The `isSelected` detail property
contains the selection state.

params.name: detail.isSelected
params.description: true for selection and false for deselection

core-activate.name: core-activate
core-activate.description: Fired when an item element is tapped.
